text: Data ownership transforms from user-centric to system-centric, fundamentally altering the relationship between individuals and their information.
IF  THEN Explicit consent is required for data collection and usage.
IF  THEN Data minimization is necessary to avoid unnecessary surveillance.
CLAIM: Personal data is transitioning from being an extension of the self to a commodity owned by the data collection systems.
Continuous data extraction enables prediction and behavioral modification.
Certainty drives the intensification of surveillance capitalism's operational capabilities.
IF  THEN Prioritize prediction accuracy by expanding data collection scope.
IF  THEN Interventions must be timed to align with user physiological states.
IF  THEN Test behavioral modification techniques through systematic experimentation.
CLAIM: Surveillance capitalism evolved from extraction to execution economies.
CLAIM: Behavioral modification aims for guaranteed commercial outcomes.
CLAIM: Digital architecture enables unprecedented behavioral prediction capabilities.
Power structures evolve by adapting their methods to changing circumstances.
Control is maintained through the modification of human behavior rather than direct coercion.
IF  THEN Organizations must monitor and analyze behavioral data to predict and monetize user actions.
IF  THEN Effective control requires replacing traditional human-centric interactions with algorithmic processes.
CLAIM: Surveillance capitalism can reshape society through unprecedented behavioral engineering.
CLAIM: Digital technology enables market-driven control that surpasses traditional political domination.
Focus on observable actions and behaviors to extract surplus.
Operationalize control through measurable data and reinforcement cycles.
IF  THEN Reduce human experience to quantifiable behavioral data for market exploitation.
IF  THEN Transform natural human agency into algorithmic stimulus-response patterns.
CLAIM: Surveillance capitalism can completely subsume human self-determination.
CLAIM: Digital behavioral modification operates effectively without traditional legal constraints.
Data-driven systems fundamentally reshape power dynamics by enabling granular control over human behavior.
The strategic accumulation of behavioral data creates asymmetric advantages in commercial and social contexts.
IF  THEN Organizations must establish clear boundaries between explicit user consent and the automated exploitation of behavioral data (data exhaust).
IF  THEN Governments should develop regulatory frameworks to limit the instrumentalization of personal data beyond its immediate utility.
CLAIM: Contemporary business models derive significant value from the continuous harvesting of user-generated behavioral data.
CLAIM: The distinction between fundamental rights and instrumentalized data collection is increasingly blurred in digital societies.
Understand human behavior to predict and shape future needs
Behavioral patterns can be systematically analyzed and utilized
IF  THEN Design systems to continuously collect behavioral surplus
IF  THEN Monetize attention by extracting previously unquantifiable human responses
CLAIM: Surveillance capitalism creates a new economic paradigm based on behavioral data
CLAIM: Attention is a quantifiable resource that can be bought and sold
